intro: Lisianthius chelonoides, commonly known as the spiral tangle, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its unique spiral arrangement of leaves and flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes and swampy areas. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in shades of pink to purple. It plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various insects and wildlife.
